reviewText:
It took me forever to set up my show and it still wasn't synced properly but that's ok. I love, love, love fireworks and this program is great. Any fan of fireworks will love this. Once you get the hang of it, it's easy to work with.


PROSEasy to use drag and drop feature
Graphics and water reflections
Different angle camera POVs
Custom Fireworks creating
Your own music import

CONSInvisible fireworks
Limited type of firework colors/sets
Limited areas/scenery to create your show in
Annoying built-in music looping when creating
No option to view from a certain point in your track
No snap-to feature on the boat/docks for perfect alignment
All saves vanishing if you delete an older save and no save override
Extreme swapping lag from sequence to placement when you have a lot of fireworks on the sequence lines

Overall, I really enjoy this simulator, even with it's many flaws. I can see myself putting tons of hours into it, just for the pure enjoyment of watching the entire finished fireworks show that I've created.

As a side note, the Devs have abandoned this simulator. You will get no help from them, no updates, no bug fixes. Only the community can help you, but we are all having the same problems. Buying this game now is just paying the ones who don't care about their game or their community.
voteText: 27 of 32 people (84%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Overall great game if you WANT to create your own firework simulation in sync with music.


Minor issues that could be fixed/improved:

There should be mouse wheel scrolling in sequence editor,
The firework when selected in placement should indicate which one you have selected,
When playing the simulation you should be allowed to skip to a section you want to see,
When creating a firework, it should allow you to clear the firework placed instead of clearing the whole rack,

If the above were fixed it would be even better than it already is. The above are just minor problems that I noticed while playing. Click here to see my video:


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=__zZaHJ-AqY


Note: if thinking about using the ingame recorder, dont. Use Fraps instead since it doesnt cause the game to lag as much.

reviewText: For some reason I rushed into buying this game simply because I've always wanted a fireworks simulator, and this looked really good from the screenshots and videos. But unfortunately it's just not as good as it makes it out to be. On the simple side, there are overused sounds, quite a limited set of fireworks and it's just simply overall quite a poor design for a simulator - it's more of a worktop or, do I call it a sandbox? On the technical side, it's even worse sadly, it takes up far much more GPU power than it needs to and the way it has been coded makes it hard to edit or even try open back something you've made without it causing errors, even for someone as tech-savy as me who understands the Windows Registry can't seem to even get it fixed. I had really high hopes for this game when I saw it released on Steam, but disappointed with the outcome even for a $10 game - overall I've spent less and received much better developed games.

reviewText:
I don't normally write reviews on Steam games, but this game, really deserves it.

Wow, what can I say? Fireworks Simulator is brand new into the market released only two days ago and come to think about it I'm sure your'e all thinking well here's ANOTHER simulator game..."
But let me stop you there
date: Fireworks Simulator is unlike anything I have ever played on Steam before and in a good way.\n\nWelcome to this crazy
recommended:
psychedelic world of bright lights and explosions.
I booted this up to try it and found myself 2 hours later in awe of a pretty awesome firework show I had built from scratch to music from my computer I had previously imported.

If you buy this game be prepared to have your imagination captured
hoursPlayed:
skills put to the test and most importantly have a lot of fun regardless of your age.
I can assure you this is way more than placing pretty lights and watching them go bang.
Unlike other "flop" simulator games I think this might just become a hit and the developers deserve every credit for it.

The question is
voteText: can you top the London New Year Fireworks? You can certainly try!!"

At les in the sequencer
date: instead of the pic of the place you are shooting
recommended:
put a simulation of your show.

reviewText: This is a great simulator. It has lots of shells to work with. The display graphics are great if you have a 2Gb video card or better. The only limitations are as follow: You can't use artists mp3 as background music then post it to certain social media due to copyright laws and You only have two locations for launching fireworks. You launch from either bardges or a golf course. If you forget and create a display with an artists music some social media will remove it and warn you about breaking copyright laws.

reviewText: First Impressions:\n\nThe sequencer reminded me of Roller Coaster Tycoon 3" a bit in that you can drop various fireworks onto a timeline.  "Fireworks Simulator" takes that a step further and adds the ability to adjust music and camera angles.  I would have really liked a freeform camera that let you zoom around to any position you wanted...instead you're limited to about six preset angles.  It's a solid simulator and it works once you figure it out
date: but I didn't see a whole lot of content.  For ten bucks
recommended: I'd have to give this a partial recommend...I think five would have been a bit more realistic.\n\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-b3oQvShcBQ"

reviewText: This game seemed great at first, the menu screens worked at a solid frame-rate. Right as soon as I pulled up one of the demo shows, the frame-rate dropped from 60fps to 10fps. Not a good sign when you turn down all of the game graphics and still get a poor frame-rate. I didn't let that get me down until the game caused my computer to blue screen. I haven't even started making a show and with the horrible frame-rate and potential crashing of your system, I would not recommend this game. Waste of money. Also, the preview video shows a solid 60 fps, where's that in the game?

reviewText:
This game is fun. You can load your own music into it and then it becomes a time burner as you spend the next hour  testing all the different fireworks and getting it just right so the fireworks coordinate to the song... only to save it and lose everything. Patch 1.1 did NOT fix the save issues. I just lost the past 60 minutes of music/firework coordination and I was only 1/3 done with my song.

That sucks.

This game is in beta mode at best.

There should be a copy and paste function as well as a drag and drop to facilitate firework placement. You should also be able to 'see' the fireworks along with the music when you are in the sequencer instead of constantly having to switch back and forth between placement of the fireworks and then trying to line it up with the music. Also every time you hit save it does not need to make a new copy of the game (that doesnt work anyway). It should save over the previous work unless you rename it to something new.

The game only has two working backdrops. More is better. Being able to rotate your POV around the landscape would also be a plus.

I dont plan on playing this game anymore until they fix the save feature. It is pointless to waste your time on a simulator that doesnt save your work.

I'm still giving it a thumbs up because it has potential, mostly I want  to encourage the developers to fix their program and the fireworks are beautiful in high resolution. Someday this will hopefully be a great simulator.
